item.title: Pro wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at 71
item.description: Wrestling icon Hulk Hogan has died, police and World Wrestling Entertainment said Thursday.

item.title: Hulk Hogan dies at 71, WWE says
item.description: Pro wrestling legend Hulk Hogan has died, World Wrestling Entertainment said in a statement on social media. He was 71. CBS News' Shanelle Kaul has more.

item.title: Top DOJ official Todd Blanche will meet with Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche is meeting with Ghislaine Maxwell in Florida about the case involving convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Chilling details emerge about strange incidents before Idaho murders
item.description: Hundreds of documents were released by police after Bryan Kohberger was sentenced to life in prison for the murders of Kaylee Goncalves, Madison Mogen, Xana Kernodle and Ethan Chapin.

item.title: RNC's Whatley and ex-Gov. Cooper plan to run for Senate in N.C., sources say
item.description: The White House has blessed Republican National Committee chairman Michael Whatley's plans, one source said.

item.title: Trump to visit Federal Reserve, keeping heat on chair Jerome Powell
item.description: President Trump is visiting the Federal Reserve's headquarters in Washington, keeping up the intense pressure he's been putting on Fed chair Jerome Powell because the Fed hasn't lowered interest rates.

item.title: Runaway wallabies spark police chase spanning 2 countries
item.description: Footage of the marsupials hopping around urban areas, at times scared by passing motorists, went viral on social media.

item.title: Trump's Scotland visit to feature golf resorts, trade talks and protests
item.description: Trump is set to visit Scotland, his mother's ancestral home where he owns 2 golf courses, for a mix of business and pleasure. But some Scots are taking no pleasure.

item.title: Johnson says Jeffrey Epstein files controversy is not a hoax
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson is weighing in on calls for the release of the files on Jeffrey Epstein's case. Johnson spoke to Major Garrett on "The Takeout" as legislative efforts to obtain the files from the Department of Justice progress.

item.title: Petangon insists Hegseth didn't share classified information in Signal chat, contradicting watchdog
item.description: The Pentagon is responding to reports that its internal watchdog detected details from a classified email in Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's communications on Signal about a strike against Yemen. The chat became controversial after an Atlantic reporter was mistakenly added to a top official chain on the matter. CBS News' Charlie D'Agata reports.

item.title: Details on efforts to obtain DOJ files on Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Lawmakers are joining the growing calls for the Department of Justice to release its files on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. CBS News' Ed O'Keefe breaks down the latest.

item.title: House Speaker Johnson says Jeffrey Epstein case is "not a hoax"
item.description: "We want full transparency," House Speaker Mike Johnson told CBS News, as the Jeffrey Epstein case fuels GOP infighting.

item.title: Israel brings back Gaza negotiating team for ceasefire "consultations"
item.description: Israel issued a statement indicating that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has asked the Gaza negotiating team to return to Israel for ceasefire talks. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio reports.

item.title: Latest news on Trump administration's legal battle on birthright citizenship
item.description: The White House is reacting after a federal court ruled that President Trump's executive order on birthright citizenship is unconstitutional. CBS News' Katrina Kaufman reports.

item.title: DHS, HHS among agencies hacked in Microsoft Sharepoint breach
item.description: Department of Homeland Security headquarters, several of its agencies and the Department of Health and Human Services have been hacked as part of a wider breach of Microsoft SharePoint.​

item.title: Tanya Simon named as executive producer of "60 Minutes"
item.description: Award-winning journalist Tanya Simon has been named executive producer of "60 Minutes​," America's #1 news program.

item.title: Report: Trump briefed on mentions in Epstein files before DOJ suspended their release
item.description: The Wall Street Journal reports that former Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Trump his name appeared in the Epstein files. The White House denies wrongdoing.

item.title: Our publishing principles at CBS News
item.description: At CBS News and Stations, we are dedicated to providing the highest quality journalism under standards we pioneered and continue to set today.

item.title: 6/19: CBS Morning News
item.description: Israel and Iran trade fire as President Trump weighs U.S. involvement; Wage growth for people who stay in their jobs is outpacing those who switch.

item.title: Breaking down Bryan Kohberger's sentencing in Idaho
item.description: Bryan Kohberger showed no emotion as he was sentenced to life without parole for the killings of four University of Idaho students. The hearing included raw and emotional testimony from the victims' families.

item.title: 7/24: CBS Morning News
item.description: House committee votes to subpoena Justice Department for Epstein files; Survey finds 1 in 4 workers more worried about job security.

item.title: How retirement led Georgia couple to build a rum empire
item.description: After retiring, Erik and Karin Vonk combined their love of farming and spirits to create Richland Rum. Nearly 25 years later, their Georgia-made rum is earning high praise from critics across the globe.

item.title: Survey: Americans say $800K needed to feel secure
item.description: A new Charles Schwab survey finds many Americans believe they need over $800,000 to be financially comfortable, yet a third have no financial plan. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger joins to explain what to do.

item.title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals
item.description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.

item.title: Job loss anxiety is rising, according to new data
item.description: A new Bankrate survey shows job loss anxiety is rising among certain groups of Americans. Mark Hamrick, a senior economic analyst for Bankrate, joins "CBS News Mornings" with more on the data.

item.title: UnitedHealth says it's under federal investigation for civil fraud
item.description: The health-care giant said it has started complying with both criminal and civil requests from federal investigators and it was cooperating with them.

item.title: Trump heads to Scotland to visit his golf courses, meet prime ministers
item.description: President Trump will head to Scotland to visit his golf courses there and to meet with the prime minister. Trump will also meet with United Kingdom Prime Minister Keir Starmer while he is overseas. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio reports.

item.title: Uber is starting service allowing women to choose female drivers, riders
item.description: The ride-share company said it's piloting the women-focused program in Los Angeles, San Francisco and Detroit.

item.title: White House unveils U.S. strategic plan on AI. Here's what it includes.
item.description: A White House AI Action Plan outlines steps to advance U.S. artificial intelligence innovation and infrastructure.

item.title: Roommate of Idaho murder victims tearfully speaks at Kohberger's sentencing
item.description: Dylan Mortensen read her victim impact statement through tears at Bryan Kohberger's sentencing hearing Wednesday.
